item.title: Anonymous: Comment 1
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
What good is TOR if every tor exit is identified by "anonymizer5.torservers.net" or "tor-exit.torserver.net" and is now blocked by so many websites?

TOR used to be useful when those websites didn't employ means to block it, but now it's a different story... think about something or give up the illusion of anonymity.

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 2
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: How will tor protect against the FBI and other anti privacy/ anti crypto systems when if the fbi requires backdoor in crypto systems?

item.description:

~bee!!!!!!!

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 4
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
I need some advice.

I have installed, on a USB, vidalia bundle 0.2.1.26-0.2.9.exe (under Vista ,32 bit)

I have as directories:

Polipo
Tor
Torbutton
Vidalia

I have Fireox portable installed searately.

I am thinking of updating this suite (Vidalia bundle), but can not fathom which bundle to use.

The simplest solution would be the best.

One of my difficulties is trying to determine which of the products are updates of my existing products!

Can anyone advise?

Thanks.

A

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 5
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
Is 208.53.142.39 aka tor-exit-proxy3-readme.formlessnetworking.net a honey pot?

No matter how many times I select "New Identity", TOR ends up always exiting through this tor exit (or another one in Dallas, TX).

What gives?

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 6
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: Read the docs/FAQ. Tor reuses paths. This is good for security.

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 7
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description: Thank you for making this tool available to people and all of your hard work.

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 8
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
Tor v1.0.4 not working on rooted LG Ally running Froyo. Seems to come up, with green "power" button eventually displayed after several steps -- "Connected to the Tor network" displayed. But no actual Tor connectivity -- the "Check" button pulls up Browser with "Sorry, You are not using Tor." displayed.

Other web apps, e.g., email, show the usual IP address of the phone, nothing changed. So it's pretty convincing that there really is no Tor connection.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

-Ken C.
